properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 4 at 4:56AM AKST until January 5 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 40 below occuring. The cold wind
chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to
exposed skin. Northeast winds gusting to 30 mph. Drifting snow
will cause large drifts to form.

* WHERE...Central Interior over Elliot Highway Summits.

* WHEN...Now to 6 AM Sunday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northeast winds gusting to 30 mph will
cause blowing and drifting snow and wind chills to 40 below over
Elliot Highway Summits. Travelers should be prepared to
encounter snow drifts and dangerously cold wind chills. Winds
are expected to decrease Sunday morning.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind
speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite
and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST SUNDAY
